In my opinion, Asians portrayed in American/western media can be very simplistic and offensive. They are often portrayed as being very smart, but also very socially awkward and shy. Being very smart in America is not looked kindly upon by a large minority of our population. So that too can be a damaging stereotype. I have known a variety of Asian people and some are smart, shy or awkward but most are just somewhere in between like the rest of us. Other then slight differences in facial features, they are just like every other human on earth. They fall along a spectrum of different social and personal types.   have also noticed that Asian men are often portrayed as being very effeminate.
 They are never the football player, they are always the almost a-sexual nerds. 
 have also noticed that Asian women are often portrayed as being very submissive and quiet.

I have known a variety of Asian people and some are smart, shy or awkward but most are just somewhere in between like the rest of us. Other then slight differences in facial features, they are just like every other human on earth. They fall along a spectrum of different social and personal types.   have also noticed that Asian men are often portrayed as being very effeminate.
 They are never the football player, they are always the almost a-sexual nerds. 
 have also noticed that Asian women are often portrayed as being very submissive and quiet.
 Or the exact opposite. These two sterotypes are also very unfair. While some Asian cultu

---

In my opinion, Asians portrayed in American/western media can be very simplistic and offensive. They are often portrayed as being very smart, but also very socially awkward and shy. Being very smart in America is not looked kindly upon by a large minority of our population. So that too can be a damaging stereotype. I have known a variety of Asian people and some are smart, shy or awkward but most are just somewhere in between like the rest of us. Other then slight differences in facial features, they are just like every other human on earth. Other then slight differences in facial features, they are just like every other human on earth. They fall along a spectrum of different social and personal types.   have also noticed that Asian men are often portrayed as being very effeminate.
 They are never the football player, they are always the almost a-sexual nerds. 
 have also noticed that Asian women are often portrayed as being very submissive and quiet.
 Or the exact opposite. These two sterotypes are also very unfair. The few asian women I have gotten to know have been a mix of all these things

In my opinion, Asians portrayed in American/western media can be very simplistic and offensive. They are often portrayed as being very smart, but also very socially awkward and shy. Being very smart in America is not looked kindly upon by a large minority of our population. So that too can be a damaging stereotype. I have known a variety of Asian people and some are smart, shy or awkward but most are just somewhere in between like the rest of us. Other then slight differences in facial features, they are just like every other human on earth. They fall along a spectrum of different social and personal types.   have also noticed that Asian men are often portrayed as being very effeminate.
 They are never the football player, they are always the almost a-sexual nerds. 
 have also noticed that Asian women are often portrayed as being very submissive and quiet.
 Or the exact opposite. These two sterotypes are also very unfair. The few asian women I have gotten to know have been a mix of these triats and many more. People are much to complex to reduce them

Being very smart in America is not looked kindly upon by a large minority of our population. So that too can be a damaging stereotype. I have known a variety of Asian people and some are smart, shy or awkward but most are just somewhere in between like the rest of us. Other then slight differences in facial features, they are just like every other human on earth. They fall along a spectrum of different social and personal types.   have also noticed that Asian men are often portrayed as being very effeminate.
 They are never the football player, they are always the almost a-sexual nerds. 
 have also noticed that Asian women are often portrayed as being very submissive and quiet.
 Or the exact opposite. These two sterotypes are also very unfair. The few asian women I have gotten to know have been a mix of these triats and many more. People are much to complex to reduce them to a few simple stereotypes. Not just Asian people but all people. It has just been the Asian people in American media that has put a bad tast

In my opinion, Asians portrayed in American/western media can be very simplistic and offensive. They are often portrayed as being very smart, but also very socially awkward and shy. Being very smart in America is not looked kindly upon by a large minority of our population. So that too can be a damaging stereotype. I have known a variety of Asian people and some are smart, shy or awkward but most are just somewhere in between like the rest of us. Other then slight differences in facial features, they are just like every other human on earth. They fall along a spectrum of different social and personal types.   have also noticed that Asian men are often portrayed as being very effeminate.
 They are never the football player, they are always the almost a-sexual nerds. 
 have also noticed that Asian women are often portrayed as being very submissive and quiet.
 Or the exact opposite. These two sterotypes are also very unfair. The few asian women I have gotten to know have been a mix of these triats and many more. People are much to complex to reduce them to a few simple stereotypes. Not just Asian people but all people. It has just been the Asian people in American media that has put a bad taste in my mouth over the years and

They fall along a spectrum of different social and personal types.   have also noticed that Asian men are often portrayed as being very effeminate.
 They are never the football player, they are always the almost a-sexual nerds. 
 have also noticed that Asian women are often portrayed as being very submissive and quiet.
 Or the exact opposite. These two sterotypes are also very unfair. The few asian women I have gotten to know have been a mix of these triats and many more. People are much to complex to reduce them to a few simple stereotypes. Not just Asian people but all people. It has just been the Asian people in American media that has put a bad taste in my mouth over the years and I think its time we address
